prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: My guide. This industrious young man is both a monk in training and a Khura'inese tour guide.
Character 1
Name: Maya Fey
Description: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.
Character 2
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensic investigator.
Character 3
Name: Tahrust Inmee
Description: Khura'inist high priest in charge of the rites of Lady Kee'ra. Killed during the Purification Rite. Has a clergyman's mark on his brow.
Character 4
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 5
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last moments of the dead.
Character 6
Name: Puhray Zeh'lot
Description: An apprentice priest living in the high priest's house. He's like part of the family.
Character 7
Name: ??? → Datz Are'bal
Description: A strange guy. You can't see his face on account of his beard. Pretty suspicious, if you ask me.
Character 8
Name: Beh'leeb Inmee
Description: Widow of the victim. She usually plays the part of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists. It reads: The Purification Rite is a three-part ceremony held when the moon is directly over the summit of Mt. Poniponi. It begins with the Transformation Rite. The high priest reads scripture dons the robes of Lady Kee'ra, which have been purified with incense. Next is the Rite of Water, in which the priestess enters the spring dressed as Lady Kee'ra, and the high priest purifies both Lady Kee'ra and her dagger. The ceremony ends with the Rite of Fire, in which the priestess circles the sacred flames to purify her soul. The two then devote themselves to prayer until the rite comes to a close two days later at noontime.
Evidence 2
Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things. [caption] It reads: - Lady Kee'ra Returns to Battle Rebels - The Lady Kee'ra-like figure that appeared two years ago remains a mystery. Some town elders see her as Lady Kee'ra in the flesh. Such rumors are fueling the enthusiasm for today's Purification Rite. - Today's Purification Rite - The thick, white ice that froze the ground from the Inner Sanctum to the Plaza of Devotion until yesterday has melted. The rite can now go on as planned. We give thanks for the blessings of the Holy Mother and Lady Kee'ra. Hap'piraki! - Escaped Prisoner Alert! - Police are asking the kingdom's subjects to be on the lookout for a male insurgent who escaped from Royal Penitentiary No. 4 yesterday. - Weather Forecast - The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature will make for excellent prayer weather. Be warned, however, that we will see a cold front move in overnight.
Evidence 3
Name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 4
Name: Ritual Curtain
Description: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.
Evidence 5
Name: Bloodstained Letter
Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.
Evidence 6
Name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
Description: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.
Evidence 7
Name: Inner Sanctum Photo
Description: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.
Evidence 8
Name: Maya's Statement
Description: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.
Evidence 9
Name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
Description: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.
Evidence 10
Name: Warbaa'd Arrow
Description: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.
Evidence 11
Name: Mountain Range Poster
Description: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area. Mt. Poniponi is 2298 meters tall and to the west. The Inner Sanctum is 2310 meters tall and to the east.
Evidence 12
Name: Envelope
Description: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.
Evidence 13
Name: Wanted Poster
Description: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.
Evidence 14
Name: Plumed Punisher Strap
Description: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.
Evidence 15
Name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
Description: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.
Evidence 16
Name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
Description: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.
Evidence 17
Name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 18
Name: Warbaa'd Dagger
Description: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.
Evidence 19
Name: Brand New Flag
Description: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.
Evidence 20
Name: Nahmanda Flower
Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.
Evidence 21
Name: Beh'leeb's Statement
Description: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.
Evidence 22
Name: Family Photo
Description: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.
Evidence 23
Name: Tome of Secrets
Description: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidence 24
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.
Evidence 25
Name: Golden Orb
Description: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.
Evidence 26
Name: Rebel Hideout Photo
Description: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance. A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.
Evidence 27
Name: Warbaa'd Statue
Description: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: That night, I was up at the top of Mt. Poniponi, the mountain next to the Inner Sanctum.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 1
Testimony: I hate crowds, so I climbed up there to pray in peace
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 2
Testimony: I know it's a no-no, but since there was no one around...
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 3
Testimony: ...I used my binoculars to spy on the rite at the Inner Sanctum.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 4
Testimony: That's when I saw the accused... stab the high priest with a dagger!
Person: Ihmus

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me start by understanding the setup.

We have a murder case where Tahrust Inmee, the high priest, was killed during the Purification Rite. The defendant is accused of stabbing him with a dagger. There's also another victim, Puhray Zeh'lot, who was killed in the Plaza of Devotion.

Looking at the evidence, I see that the Warbaa'd Dagger (Evidence 18) is described as a dagger modeled after a warbaa'd, said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra. This dagger is a key piece of evidence because it's the alleged murder weapon.

Now, looking at the testimonies, Testimony 4 from Ihmus claims that the accused stabbed the high priest with a dagger. This directly implicates the defendant using a dagger in the crime.

But wait, I also notice that the Warbaa'd Dagger is mentioned in Evidence 18, and it's linked to Lady Kee'ra, who is a significant figure in their culture. However, the testimony doesn't mention anything about the dagger's origin or its connection to Lady Kee'ra. It just says the accused used a dagger.

Now, considering the contradiction, maybe the issue is that the dagger's description or origin doesn't align with the testimony. For example, if the dagger was supposed to be in a specific place or have certain characteristics that don't match the testimony, that could be a contradiction.

Alternatively, perhaps the testimony incorrectly identifies the type of weapon used, while the evidence specifies it's a Warbaa'd Dagger, which might have unique features not mentioned in the testimony.

Wait, looking again, the testimony says the accused stabbed the high priest with a dagger, but the evidence describes the dagger as a Warbaa'd, which is a specific type. If the testimony doesn't mention the specific type, maybe that's not a contradiction. However, if the dagger's characteristics don't align with the crime, that could be an issue.

Another angle: The dagger's presence in the crime scene versus the testimony's account. If the testimony says the dagger was used, but the evidence shows it wasn't at the scene or was planted, that would contradict.

But in this case, the dagger is presented as the murder weapon, so the testimony aligns with that. Hmm, maybe I'm missing something.

Wait, perhaps the contradiction lies elsewhere. Let me check other evidence and testimonies. For example, the crime photos and the autopsy reports might show inconsistencies with the testimony.

Looking at Evidence 7, the Inner Sanctum Photo shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area, and a lantern. If the testimony claims the accused was seen stabbing the priest, but the photo shows no signs of a struggle or the dagger nearby, that could contradict.

Alternatively, if the autopsy report (Evidence 3) says the wound was from a bladed weapon, but the testimony describes the dagger in a way that doesn't match the wound, that would be a contradiction.

Wait, the autopsy report says the cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon. The testimony says the accused stabbed the high priest with a dagger. That seems consistent, not contradictory.

Maybe the contradiction is that the dagger (Evidence 18) has specific characteristics, like being a Warbaa'd, which the testimony doesn't mention, implying it's a different type of dagger.

Alternatively, perhaps the testimony incorrectly identifies the accused as the one who used the dagger, while the evidence suggests someone else did, based on fingerprints or other clues.

Wait, looking back, the evidence doesn't mention whose fingerprints are on the dagger. If the testimony accuses the defendant, but the evidence shows someone else's fingerprints, that would contradict.

But in the given evidence, I don't see any mention of fingerprints on the dagger. So maybe that's not it.

Another possibility: The testimony says the accused stabbed the priest, but the evidence shows that the priest's wound doesn't match the dagger's characteristics. For example, if the dagger is too large or has a different blade shape than the wound.

But without specific details on the dagger's characteristics, it's hard to say. However, given the options, the most likely contradiction is between the testimony claiming the accused used a dagger and the evidence identifying the dagger as a Warbaa'd, which might have a unique feature not aligning with the testimony's description.

Wait, perhaps the dagger was found at the scene, but the testimony doesn't mention it being there, implying the defendant didn't use it. But the testimony does mention using a dagger, so that aligns.

I'm a bit stuck. Maybe I should look for another pair. Let me consider other evidence and testimonies.

Looking at Evidence 1, the Rites Guide describes the Purification Rite, which includes the Rite of Fire. The testimony from Ihmus mentions seeing the accused stab the priest during the rite. If the timing or location described in the testimony contradicts the guide, that could be an issue.

But the Rites Guide says the rite ends with the Rite of Fire, and the testimony says Ihmus was watching during the rite, so that seems consistent.

Another angle: The crime photos (Evidence 7) show the scene, but if they don't align with the testimony's account of where the stabbing occurred, that could be a contradiction.

Alternatively, the bloodstained letter (Evidence 5) might have information that contradicts the testimony.

Wait, the bloodstained letter has a giant bloodstain, making it unreadable. If the testimony claims the accused wrote something, but the letter can't be read, that could contradict.

But the testimony doesn't mention the letter, so maybe not.

Hmm, perhaps the contradiction is that the testimony says the accused used a dagger, but the evidence (Warbaa'd Dagger) suggests it was used by Lady Kee'ra, implying someone else might have used it.

But that's speculative. The most straightforward contradiction is that the testimony implicates the defendant with a dagger, but the evidence (Warbaa'd Dagger) might have characteristics that don't match, such as being too large or having a different origin.

Alternatively, maybe the dagger wasn't present at the scene, but the testimony says it was used.

Wait, the dagger is presented as evidence, so it was found. Therefore, the testimony aligns with that.

I think I'm overcomplicating it. The contradiction is likely between the testimony claiming the accused used a dagger and the evidence (Warbaa'd Dagger) having specific characteristics not mentioned, implying it wasn't the murder weapon.

But without more details, it's hard to be sure. Based on the options, I'll go with {"evidence": 18, "testimony": 4} as the contradiction.
</think>

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I saw their shadowy silhouettes, projected against the ritual curtain!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 1
Testimony: The figures were created by the light of the full moon on that clear and still night.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 2
Testimony: She was just a shadow, but I could tell it was the accused, reverse-gripping that dagger!
Person: Ihmus

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. I'm given a set of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I need to find a pair where an evidence and a testimony contradict each other. 

First, I'll look through the testimonies to understand what each person is saying. In this case, the only testimony provided is from someone named Ihmus. They claim to have seen shadowy silhouettes created by the light of the full moon, projecting against the ritual curtain. They specifically mention seeing the accused with a dagger, reverse-gripping it.

Next, I'll examine the evidences to see which ones might relate to this testimony. Evidence 4 is the Ritual Curtain, which is described as a curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.

Now, considering the testimony, Ihmus claims to have seen the accused through the ritual curtain using the light of the full moon. However, the evidence states that the curtain was shut during the rite, meaning it was closed and not allowing light to pass through. This creates a contradiction because if the curtain was shut, it wouldn't have been possible for Ihmus to see through it, especially with the described clarity of seeing shadowy silhouettes and the dagger.

Therefore, the contradiction lies between the Ritual Curtain evidence (Evidence 4) and Ihmus's testimony (Testimony 0). The evidence suggests the curtain was closed, blocking visibility, while the testimony claims visibility through it.
</think>

cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. I've been given a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The final answer should be in the format {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}.

First, I'll go through the characters to understand who's involved. The main character here is Ahlbi Ur'gaid, who is both a monk in training and a Khura'inese tour guide. There's also Maya Fey, a spirit medium, and Ema Skye, a detective. The victim is Tahrust Inmee, the high priest, and the prosecutor is Nahyuta Sahdmadhi. Rayfa Padma Khura'in is the crown princess and priestess. Puhray Zeh'lot is an apprentice priest, and Datz Are'bal is a mysterious figure. Beh'leeb Inmee is the widow of the victim.

Next, I'll look at the evidences. Evidence 0 is the attorney's badge, which is just a formality. Evidence 1 is a guide to Khura'inese rites, explaining the Purification Rite. Evidence 2 is a newspaper from May 9th, detailing the weather, Lady Kee'ra's activities, and an escaped prisoner alert. Evidence 3 is the autopsy report of Tahrust Inmee, showing he died from a bladed weapon. Evidence 4 is the Ritual Curtain, which was shut during the rite. Evidence 5 is a bloodstained letter, Evidence 6 are prayer flags, Evidence 7 is a photo of the Inner Sanctum, Evidence 8 is Maya's statement, and so on.

Now, looking at the testimonies, Testimony 0 to 6 are from Ihmus. He claims he was never at the Inner Sanctum, it's impossible to climb there, the gate is locked, and he can't fly. He also mentions that lawyers are scary.

I need to find a contradiction between an evidence and a testimony. Let's consider Testimony 4, where Ihmus says the plaza gate is locked from the side facing the Inner Sanctum. Looking at Evidence 4, the Ritual Curtain was shut during the rite, which suggests that the area was isolated. However, if the gate was locked, it would support that the area was indeed isolated, but there might be a contradiction if the evidence suggests otherwise.

Wait, but the evidence says the curtain was shut, not necessarily that the gate was locked. So if the curtain was shut, it implies isolation, but Ihmus's testimony about the locked gate might contradict if the evidence suggests the gate was accessible. However, the evidence doesn't mention the gate's lock status, only that the curtain was shut. Therefore, there might not be a direct contradiction.

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 3, where Ihmus says the rocks are loose and crumbly, making it impossible to climb. If there's evidence suggesting someone did climb, that would contradict. But I don't see such evidence here.

Another angle: Testimony 5 mentions that he can't fly, which is a humorous way of saying he couldn't reach the Inner Sanctum. If there's evidence suggesting someone did reach it, that would contradict, but again, I don't see that evidence.

Wait, maybe Testimony 4 about the locked gate and Evidence 4 about the curtain being shut. If the curtain was shut, it might imply the gate was open or closed. But without more details, it's hard to say.

Alternatively, Testimony 2 says it's impossible to get there, but if there's evidence suggesting someone did get there, that would contradict. But I don't see such evidence.

Perhaps the best fit is Testimony 4 about the locked gate and Evidence 4 about the curtain being shut. If the curtain being shut implies the gate was open, that would contradict the testimony. But I'm not sure.

Alternatively, Testimony 0 says he was never there, but if there's evidence placing him there, that would contradict. But I don't see such evidence.

Wait, looking back, Evidence 16 is a photo of Puhray Zeh'lot's death, but that's unrelated.

I think the best possible contradiction is between Testimony 4 and Evidence 4. If the curtain was shut, it might imply the gate was open, contradicting the testimony that the gate was locked.

But I'm not entirely confident. Another possibility is Testimony 3 about the loose rocks and Evidence 27 about the Warbaa'd Statue being a revolving door, but that seems unrelated.

Wait, Evidence 27 says the statue is a revolving door, which might suggest an alternative way in or out, contradicting Testimony 3 about the rocks being loose. But I'm not sure.

Alternatively, Testimony 5 about not being able to fly and Evidence 14 about the Plumed Punisher Strap, which plays a theme when pressed. Not directly related.

I think the most plausible contradiction is between Testimony 4 and Evidence 4. If the curtain was shut, it might imply the gate was open, contradicting the locked gate testimony.

So, my answer is {"evidence": 4, "testimony": 4}.
</think>

prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: My guide. This industrious young man is both a monk in training and a Khura'inese tour guide.
Character 1
Name: Maya Fey
Description: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.
Character 2
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensic investigator.
Character 3
Name: Tahrust Inmee
Description: Khura'inist high priest in charge of the rites of Lady Kee'ra. Killed during the Purification Rite. Has a clergyman's mark on his brow.
Character 4
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 5
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last moments of the dead.
Character 6
Name: Puhray Zeh'lot
Description: An apprentice priest living in the high priest's house. He's like part of the family.
Character 7
Name: ??? → Datz Are'bal
Description: A strange guy. You can't see his face on account of his beard. Pretty suspicious, if you ask me.
Character 8
Name: Beh'leeb Inmee
Description: Widow of the victim. She usually plays the part of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists. It reads: The Purification Rite is a three-part ceremony held when the moon is directly over the summit of Mt. Poniponi. It begins with the Transformation Rite. The high priest reads scripture dons the robes of Lady Kee'ra, which have been purified with incense. Next is the Rite of Water, in which the priestess enters the spring dressed as Lady Kee'ra, and the high priest purifies both Lady Kee'ra and her dagger. The ceremony ends with the Rite of Fire, in which the priestess circles the sacred flames to purify her soul. The two then devote themselves to prayer until the rite comes to a close two days later at noontime.
Evidence 2
Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things. [caption] It reads: - Lady Kee'ra Returns to Battle Rebels - The Lady Kee'ra-like figure that appeared two years ago remains a mystery. Some town elders see her as Lady Kee'ra in the flesh. Such rumors are fueling the enthusiasm for today's Purification Rite. - Today's Purification Rite - The thick, white ice that froze the ground from the Inner Sanctum to the Plaza of Devotion until yesterday has melted. The rite can now go on as planned. We give thanks for the blessings of the Holy Mother and Lady Kee'ra. Hap'piraki! - Escaped Prisoner Alert! - Police are asking the kingdom's subjects to be on the lookout for a male insurgent who escaped from Royal Penitentiary No. 4 yesterday. - Weather Forecast - The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature will make for excellent prayer weather. Be warned, however, that we will see a cold front move in overnight.
Evidence 3
Name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 4
Name: Ritual Curtain
Description: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.
Evidence 5
Name: Bloodstained Letter
Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.
Evidence 6
Name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
Description: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.
Evidence 7
Name: Inner Sanctum Photo
Description: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.
Evidence 8
Name: Maya's Statement
Description: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.
Evidence 9
Name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
Description: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.
Evidence 10
Name: Warbaa'd Arrow
Description: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.
Evidence 11
Name: Mountain Range Poster
Description: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area. Mt. Poniponi is 2298 meters tall and to the west. The Inner Sanctum is 2310 meters tall and to the east.
Evidence 12
Name: Envelope
Description: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.
Evidence 13
Name: Wanted Poster
Description: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.
Evidence 14
Name: Plumed Punisher Strap
Description: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.
Evidence 15
Name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
Description: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.
Evidence 16
Name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
Description: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.
Evidence 17
Name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 18
Name: Warbaa'd Dagger
Description: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.
Evidence 19
Name: Brand New Flag
Description: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.
Evidence 20
Name: Nahmanda Flower
Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.
Evidence 21

Description: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.
Evidence 22

Description: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.
Evidence 23
Name: Tome of Secrets
Description: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidence 24
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.
Evidence 25
Name: Golden Orb
Description: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.
Evidence 26
Name: Rebel Hideout Photo
Description: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance. A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.
Evidence 27
Name: Warbaa'd Statue
Description: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me start by going through the evidence and testimonies one by one to understand what each is saying.

First, let's look at the evidence. There are 28 pieces of evidence listed, but I need to focus on the ones that are most relevant to the testimonies given. The key evidence here seems to be Evidence 4, which is the Ritual Curtain. It describes a curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world, and mentions that the entrance was shut during the rite. This suggests that the sanctum was secure and no one could enter or exit without being noticed.

Now, looking at the testimonies, the person named Ihmus is testifying. In their testimony, they claim that they were enjoying a trek through the night sky with a homemade paraglider and were forced to make an emergency landing at the Inner Sanctum due to gale force winds. They also mention that they banged their head, causing them to lose their memory. 

The crucial point here is that if the Ritual Curtain was in place and the entrance was shut, it would have been impossible for Ihmus to enter the Inner Sanctum, especially during the rite when security would have been tight. The testimony suggests that Ihmus was at the Inner Sanctum, but the evidence contradicts this by stating that the entrance was shut and the area was isolated.

So, putting it all together, Evidence 4 (Ritual Curtain) directly contradicts Testimony 0, where Ihmus claims to have been at the Inner Sanctum. The evidence shows that the entrance was shut, making it impossible for Ihmus to have been there as they claimed.
